parameter.description: How long should the device associated to MultiSensor keep state On before sending it Off command (if the value is bigger than 255, the value would be rounded to next integer in minutes, else seconds)

parameter.name: config_39
parameter.label: 39: Low Battery Report
parameter.description: Low Battery report if bellow this value. The range of low battery value is 10% to 50%

parameter.name: config_40
parameter.label: 40: Selective Reporting
parameter.description: Send reports only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage. Set in parameters 41-44

parameter.name: config_41
parameter.label: 41: Temperature Threshold
parameter.description: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. When the unit is Celsius, threshold=Value. When the unit is Fahrenheit, threshold=Value*1.8. The accuracy is 0.1. The high byte is the part of integer, the low byte is the fractional part

parameter.name: config_42
parameter.label: 42: Humidity Threshold
parameter.description: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report

parameter.name: config_43

parameter.description: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report

parameter.name: config_44
parameter.label: 44: Battery Threshold
parameter.description: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report

parameter.name: config_45
parameter.label: 45: Ultraviolet Threshold
parameter.description: Threshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report

parameter.name: config_46
parameter.label: 46: Send Alarm Report if low temperature
parameter.description: Send an alarm report if temperature is less than -15 degrees C

parameter.name: config_101
parameter.label: 101: Group 1 Periodic Reports
parameter.description: The value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have the values: Battery=1, Ultraviolet=16, Temperature=32, Humidity=64, Light=128 Therefore if you want all sensors and the battery sending regular reports, set the parameter to 241 (1 + 16 + 32 + 64 + 128).
